title: Sergio Aguero insists Manchester City still haven't told him personally they want him to stay beyond this season
text:
Sergio Aguero insists Manchester City still haven't told him personally they want him to stay beyond this season The star striker says despite public comments on his future he hasn't sat down with the club Share Sergio Aguero is still waiting to be told by the club they want to keep him (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Sergio Aguero has accused Manchester City of failing to give him any assurances about his future. 
Aguero once again cast doubt on his City future by admitting he does not know if he will be at the club next season. 
The forward took his goal tally for the season to 22 with a double in City's 5-1 FA Cup win over Huddersfield on Wednesday. 
Aguero has now scored four times and provided two assists since reclaiming his place from the injured Gabriel Jesus. Aguero slots City's second goal in their FA Cup replay against Huddersfield (Photo: Clive Brunskill) 
Despite being back in Pep Guardiola's starting line-up, Aguero admitted he still doesn't know if he will be at City next season. 
Asked if the club had told him they want him to stay beyond this season, Aguero said: “No, no. Read More 
“One thing is the club officially says it [that they want him to stay] and another thing is to tell me. 
“That will be seen in June. My intention is to stay, but it's a long way away. 
“I have three months to give the best and, as I always said, in June it will be seen. 
“All I have to dedicate to is to playing football. The only thing to think is to give the best these three months and then you'll see. Aguero bagged a second as he finds form after getting his starting spot back (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 
“My intention is to stay. The club can say what it wants, but in June they will have to meet With me.” 
Jesus, a £27million signing from Brazilian side Palmeiras, ousted Aguero from Guardiola's line-up after making a stunning start to his City career. 
Guardiola his young attacking trio of Jesus, Raheem Sterling and Leroy Sane as "the future of City", casting doubt on Aguero's long-term prospects at the club. Aguero fell down the pecking order after Gabriel Jesus' arrival but his injury has opened the door again (Photo: Getty Images) 
City officials have privately confided that they want Aguero to stay, but the 28-year-old said he has not been given any direct assurances from those in charge at the club. 
Asked if he would turn down the chance to join Real Madrid, who want to sign him this summer, Aguero, speaking to Onda Cero, said: “I'm not thinking about Madrid or anywhere, I'm focused on City. 
“It's a breakthrough for the club to say that, but I do not want to think about what will happen to my future. Pep Guardiola hailed Aguero's performance against Huddersfield as the best he's seen (Photo: REUTERS) 
“I’m not thinking about wanting to go or anything like that, I’m just thinking about winning all the games and obviously trying to win a a title. 
“As I’ve always said, and obviously my word isn’t going to change, it’s the club who has to decide what they are going to do with me but today, more than ever, I’m only thinking about the club and helping the team. 
“I hope that in June we can win some titles, which is the most important thing, and then we'll see.” poll loading Which striker would you prefer at YOUR club? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
